column4: Tomacat_: He doesn't have another distribution installed, and anyway I think it should detect other linux installs anyway.
are you suggesting anything? am I missing something?
no, just punning on your name, never mind
what's yr windows network? file/printer sharing or just shared internet?
and anyway, it worked out of the box, until it just disappeared one day
maybe I should try to uninstall samba? (I think) it was only installed when I tried to setup a shared folder within ubuntu
oh. and I thought you might be from my neighborhood...
do what i said, then, assuming the package name is actually samba
but you might have to do something like sudo /etc/init.d/smbd restart
well, years of using it have made it a reflex to reboot...
